detaileddescription.para: This is called after the ForceImpl is created and before updateContextState(), calcForces(), or calcEnergy() is called on it. This allows it to do any necessary initialization.
Get the Force object from which this ForceImpl was created.

This method is called at the beginning of each time step. It give the ForceImpl a chance to modify the state variables (positions, velocities, and parameters) stored in the Context in arbitrary ways before integration is performed.

parameterdescription.para: the context in which the system is being simulated

memberdef.argsstring: (ContextImpl &context, bool includeForces, bool includeEnergy, int groups)=0
memberdef.name: calcForcesAndEnergy

detaileddescription.para: Calculate the force on each particle generated by this ForceImpl and/or this ForceImpl's contribution to the potential energy of the system.

parameterdescription.para: the context in which the system is being simulated
true if forces should be calculated
true if the energy should be calculated
a set of bit flags for which force groups to include. Group i should be included if (groups&(1<<i)) != 0.

simplesect.para: this force's contribution to the potential energy of the system, or 0 if this force does not contribute to potential energy (or if includeEnergy is false)

detaileddescription.para: Get a map containing the default values for all adjustable parameters defined by this ForceImpl. These parameters and their default values will automatically be added to the Context.
Get the names of all Kernels used by this Force.
Get pairs of particles connected by bonds by this force. This is used to determine which particles are part of the same molecule.

A ForceImpl provides the internal implementation of a Force. When a Context is created for a System, it creates a ForceImpl for each Force in the System. The ForceImpl is permitted to cache information from the Force or System which is needed to apply the force efficiently. If the user calls reinitialize() on the Context, all ForceImpl objects it had previously created are deleted and recreated from scratch.
This is an abstract class. Each Force subclass is responsible for defining its own ForceImpl subclass.
